questions.text: Which of the following is correctly matched?

options.label: B
options.text: Efferent arteriole mild constriction- GFR increased

questions.correct_answer: B. Efferent arteriole mild constriction- GFR increased

questions.text: Given below is the myogram of a single muscle twitch. What is the tetanizing frequency?
In a person on a high potassium diet, which part of the nephron would be expected to secrete the most potassium?
Which of the following is the correct formula for calculation of ejection fraction?
Which nephron segment is the primary site of magnesium reabsorption in normal conditions?

options.label: B
options.text: Descending thin segment of loop of henle

options.label: C
options.text: Thick ascending limb of loop of henle

questions.correct_answer: C. Thick ascending limb of loop of henle

questions.text: Which of the following waves of JVP occurs in the isovolumetric contraction phase?
At which point on the nerve action potential shown in the figure given below is the membrane closest to the equilibrium potential for potassium?

While playing football, the ball hits a 12-year old boy on his shin with considerable force. He sits on the ground and starts rubbing the area to reduce the pain. Inhibition of pain signals by tactile stimulation of the skin is mediated by which type of afferent neurons from the mechanoreceptors.
A 33-year-old national level basketball player takes human growth hormone to increase his performance. Which of the following best describes human growth hormone?

options.label: A
options.text: Secretion is stimulated by somatostatin and inhibited by ghrelin

options.label: B
options.text: It has a long half life

options.label: D
options.text: It stimulates production of IGF-1 by the liver

questions.correct_answer: D. It stimulates production of IGF-1 by the liver

questions.text: Tubular concentration of which of the following substances will be the highest at the end of PCT?
All except the following are component of juxta glomerular apparatus (JGA)-
Myogenic autoregulation of renal plasma flow occurs due to-
Least conduction velocity is seen in which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Sensory fibre from Golgi tendon organ

questions.text: A 70-year-old woman with type 2 DM is being monitored for her renal glucose handling. During the monitoring, clinician observed that glucose appeared in her urine even at low plasma glucose concentrations. What is the most likely reason?
All except the following is false about the role of funny sodium channels in pacemaker potential-

options.label: A
options.text: Funny channels open during depolarization and responsible for Ca2+ influx

options.label: B
options.text: Funny channels close upon hyperpolarization and restrict Na+ influx

options.label: C
options.text: Funny channels open upon hyperpolarization, allowing influx of both Na+ & Ca2+

options.label: D
options.text: Funny channels open upon hyperpolarization, allowing influx of both Na+ & K+

questions.correct_answer: D. Funny channels open upon hyperpolarization, allowing influx of both Na+ & K+

questions.text: All except the following are prerequisites for a functional counter current mechanism in the body-

options.label: B
options.text: Parallel and opposite flow of fluids

options.label: D
options.text: Active transport of solutes across all segments

questions.correct_answer: D. Active transport of solutes across all segments

questions.text: A 70-year-old heart transplant patient reports that he has been engaging in moderate exercise for about 45 minutes daily. Despite lacking autonomic innervation to his heart, he notices an increase in his stamina and ability to exercise over time. Given the patient’s condition, what physiological mechanism is responsible for increase in his cardiac output during exercise?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased heart rate through parasympathetic withdrawal

options.label: B
options.text: Increased heart rate through sympathetic stimulation

options.label: C
options.text: Increased heart rate through parasympathetic stimulation

options.label: D
options.text: Increased stroke volume via Frank Starling Mechanism

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased stroke volume via Frank Starling Mechanism

questions.text: Which of the following statements correctly describes the LaPlace law?

options.label: A
options.text: Capillaries are more prone to rupture due to high wall tension

options.label: B
options.text: Increased flow velocity in narrow vessels increases lateral pressure

options.label: C
options.text: The total energy in a tube or blood vessel remains constant

options.label: D
options.text: Dilated hearts have to work harder due to increased wall tension

questions.correct_answer: D. Dilated hearts have to work harder due to increased wall tension

questions.text: A 57-year-old diabetic woman is being treated with a medication that inhibits the reabsorption of glucose by the kidneys. What is the likely transporter inhibited by this medication?

A patient undergoing coronary angioplasty for MI suddenly develops hypotension, bradycardia & apnoea. Which of the following reflexes is most likely mediated by chemo sensitive vagal C fibers in the cardiopulmonary region?
Which of the following neurotransmitter is incorrectly matched with its site of production?

A researcher is studying the precision of synaptic connection between the neurons. Which of the following key proteins help in precise targeting of synaptic connections to ensure accurate neuronal communication?

A 60-year-old patient undergoes cardiac evaluation & the following values are obtained- EDV= 130 mL and the ejection fraction of 45%. Which of the following best describes the patient's cardiac parameters?

options.label: A
options.text: The stroke volume is higher than normal suggesting improved cardiac output

options.label: B
options.text: The cardiac output is higher than normal

options.label: C
options.text: The cardiac output can we calculated from the given from the given values

options.label: D
options.text: The ejection fraction of the patient is below the normal range indicating reduce ventricular function

questions.correct_answer: D. The ejection fraction of the patient is below the normal range indicating reduce ventricular function

questions.text: Which of the following statements is correct regarding timing and correlation of S1 with the ECG?

options.label: A
options.text: S1 occurs immediately after end of T wave

options.label: B
options.text: S1 begins during the ST segment and ends before the T wave

options.label: C
options.text: S1 is heard simultaneously at the peak of R wave in all the leads

options.label: D
options.text: S1 starts 0.02- 0.04s after the onset of QRS complex

questions.correct_answer: D. S1 starts 0.02- 0.04s after the onset of QRS complex

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with complains of difficulty in maintaining posture. Upon examination, the physician notices that the patient has diminished reflexes. Which of the following nerve fibres is responsible for transmitting information about the velocity and length of muscle stretch from the muscle spindle to the spinal cord?
Which of the following statement correctly describes the localization capability of the paleospinothalamic pain pathway?

options.label: A
options.text: The pathway can localize precise location of pain

options.label: B
options.text: The pathway can localize precise location of temperature

options.label: C
options.text: The pathway can localize precise location of pain to exact muscle groups involved in movements

options.label: D
options.text: The pathway localizes pain only to major body parts, such as an arm or leg due to its diffuse connectivity

questions.correct_answer: D. The pathway localizes pain only to major body parts, such as an arm or leg due to its diffuse connectivity

questions.text: A new mother calls the paediatrician because she is concerned that her infant defecates after meal. Which of the following is the cause of these normal bowel movements in newborns?

The phases of the cardiac action potential are represented by the lettered points on the diagram below. At which point on the action potential is the membrane potential most dependent on calcium permeability?
Which type of mechanoreceptor is primarily responsible for two- point discrimination and ability to read braille by detecting fine touch and texture details on the finger tips?
Which of the following statements about the basal ganglia and their associated neurotransmitters is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The caudate nucleus primarily uses glutamate as its neurotransmitter

options.label: B
options.text: The globus pallidus externus (GPe) exerts an excitatory influence on thalamus

options.label: C
options.text: The substantia nigra pars reticulata (SNpr) inhibits the thalamus using dopamine

options.label: D
options.text: The subthalamic nucleus uses glutamate to excite the globus pallidus internus (GPi)

questions.correct_answer: D. The subthalamic nucleus uses glutamate to excite the globus pallidus internus (GPi)

questions.text: The cardiovascular responses to isotonic exercise include an increase in which of the following?
Which of the following statements about climbing & mossy fibres are correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The vestibulo-cerebellar serves as the pathway for climbing fibres

options.label: B
options.text: Climbing fibres use aspartate to provide excitatory input to Purkinje cells

options.label: C
options.text: Mossy fibres use glutamate to provide excitatory signals to Granule cells

options.label: D
options.text: Climbing fibres are the terminal endings of the olivocerebellar tract

questions.correct_answer: B. Climbing fibres use aspartate to provide excitatory input to Purkinje cells

questions.text: All of the following cause heterometric regulation of cardiac output except-
Which of the following parts of the Papez circuit is incorrectly matched with their function?

options.label: A
options.text: Cingulate gyrus- controls heart rate, blood pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Mamillary body- responsible for controlling recent memories of the brain

options.label: D
options.text: Para hippocampal gyrus- spatial memory (memory of 3-dimensional space)

questions.correct_answer: B. Hippocampus- spatial memory (memory of 3-dimensional space)

questions.text: A 40-year-old male presents with a persistent dry cough and dyspnoea. CT scan of the chest shows localized airway obstruction at the level of the respiratory bronchioles. Which generation (Wiebel’s classification) is most likely affected in this patient?
What are the expected partial pressures of oxygen and carbon dioxide at the apex, middle and basal portions of the lungs in a person in erect posture?

options.label: A
options.text: At the base –PO2 is lowest and PCO2 is highest

options.label: B
options.text: At the apex- PO2 is lowest and PCO2 is highest

options.label: C
options.text: At the middle –PO2 is lowest and PCO2 is highest

options.label: D
options.text: At the base- PO2 is highest and PCO2 is lowest

questions.correct_answer: A. At the base –PO2 is lowest and PCO2 is highest

questions.text: Which of the following formulas gives the oxygen extraction ratio of a substance?
questions.correct_answer: B. (Arterial concentration - Venous concentration) / Arterial concentration

questions.text: All of the following would be expected to increase the mean systemic filling pressure except?
Which of the following contributes to higher haematocrit in venous blood?

options.label: A
options.text: Chloride shift causing swelling of red blood cells

options.label: B
options.text: Lower plasma volume in venous blood

options.label: C
options.text: Greater carbon dioxide content in venous blood

questions.text: Oxygen is classified as perfusion limited gas. What does this imply about its diffusion properties?

options.label: A
options.text: O2 uptake into pulmonary capillaries is dependent on diffusion properties of membrane

options.label: B
options.text: O2 uptake into pulmonary capillaries is dependent on temperature

options.label: C
options.text: O2 uptake into pulmonary capillaries is dependent on blood flowing through it

questions.correct_answer: C. O2 uptake into pulmonary capillaries is dependent on blood flowing through it

questions.text: Which of the following intestinal cells have high zinc concentration?
Which of the following is false about the effects of CCK on intestinal motility?
questions.correct_answer: B. Contraction of sphincter of Oddi

questions.text: Which group of neurons is involved in controlling forceful expiration?
What primary physiological change sustains increased ventilation over several days of high-altitude exposure?

options.label: C
options.text: Decrease in respiratory rate over time

questions.correct_answer: D. Compensatory renal excretion of bicarbonate

questions.text: A patient presents in the emergency department with a history of progressive respiratory distress. An arterial blood gas (ABG) analysis is obtained while the patient is breathing room air shows the following: PaO2 = 65mm Hg, SaO2 = 0.90, PaCO2 = 50mm Hg, pH = 7.30. The patient's temperature is 37 degrees C, barometric pressure is 760 mm Hg, Water vapor pressure at body temperature is 47 mmHg and respiratory quotient is 0.8. What is the patient's alveolar-arterial oxygen tension gradient; P(A-a)O2?
Which of the following substances has the highest TF/P ratios at the end of the PCT?
Shown below is the response of a hormone to a meal and insulin-induced hypoglycemia. The hormone is most likely to be which of the following?
Each molecule of troponin C can bind how many calcium ions?
Which of the following is greater in afterloaded muscle contractions as compared to preloaded muscle contractions?
Which of the following are best suited to measure the intracellular fluid volume?
ECF is what percentage of the TBW in (Ls) in a man weighing 60 kg?
Baroreceptor is which type of feedback?
If alveolar surface area is decreased by 50% and pulmonary fibrosis leads to doubling of diffusion distance, how will the diffusion of O2 be affected?
All of the following are true about gap junctions except-

options.label: A
options.text: Gap junctions form a cytoplasmic “tunnel” for diffusion of small molecules (<1000 Da) between two neighbouring cells

options.label: B
options.text: Gap junctions are formed by proteins called connexons

options.label: C
options.text: Connexons in the membrane of one cell are lined up with connexons of a neighbouring cell to form dodecameric gap junctions

questions.correct_answer: D. Gap junctions form chemical synapses

questions.text: All except the following are associated with increase in calcium conductance -

options.label: A
options.text: Upstroke of the smooth muscle action potential

options.label: B
options.text: Plateau phase of the ventricular muscle action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Downstroke of the skeletal muscle action potential

questions.correct_answer: C. Downstroke of the skeletal muscle action potential

questions.text: A 34-year-old man presents with severe migraine headaches that are accompanied by hemiparesis. Genetic analysis confirms the suspicion of an inherited channelopathy. The membrane potential will depolarize by the greatest amount if the membrane permeability increases for which of the following ions?
Which of the following characteristics of an axon is most dependent on myelination?

options.label: C
options.text: Conduction velocity of its action potential

questions.correct_answer: C. Conduction velocity of its action potential

questions.text: Which of the following organs has the highest arterio-venous oxygen differences under normal conditions?

A patient has an oxygen consumption of 240mL/min. His systemic arterial oxygen concentration is 180mL/L of blood, and his pulmonary artery concentration is 160mL/L of blood. What is his cardiac output?

A patient with MI develops progressive dyspnea and hypoxemia suggestive of cardiogenic shock. She is transferred to the ICU and a Swan-Ganz catheter is inserted. The patient is found to have a pulmonary capillary wedge pressure of 25 mm Hg, which is indicative of a decrease in which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: Net fluid reabsorption into pulmonary capillaries

questions.correct_answer: D. Net fluid reabsorption into pulmonary capillaries

questions.text: Which of the following will occur if blood flow to an alveolus is totally obstructed by a pulmonary thromboembolism?

options.label: A
options.text: V/Q ratio of the alveolus equals zero

options.label: B
options.text: Po2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

options.label: C
options.text: Po2 of the alveolus will be equal to the mixed venous Po2

options.label: D
options.text: Increase in shunting in the lung

questions.correct_answer: B. Po2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

questions.text: A 80-year-old woman resents with polyuria and polydipsia. Blood analysis reveals hypernatremia, and urinalysis shows hypotonicity with increased free water clearance. In which of the following conditions is an increased free water clearance a hallmark of the disease?

A 38-year-old male is brought to the Emergency after being thrown from his motorcycle following a collision with a stationary trolley. It is determined that he has a brain transection above the pons. How will this lesion affect the control of breathing in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: He loses voluntary control over his respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Central chemoreceptors will no longer be able to exert any control over the ventilation

options.label: D
options.text: Involuntary control over respiration will be lost but voluntary control will be present

questions.correct_answer: B. He loses voluntary control over his respiration

questions.text: A 16-year-old adolescent boy is being treated with the macrolide antibiotic erythromycin complains of nausea, intestinal cramping, and diarrhoea. The side effects are the result of the antibiotic binding to receptors in the GI tract that recognize which gastrointestinal hormone?

A 45-year-old man presents to the Emergency with shortness of breath. His OHDC was shifted from that for normal haemoglobin A depicted in the curve A in the figure given below to curve B. this finding is consistent with which of the following conditions?
questions.correct_answer: D. Recent transfusion with banked blood

questions.text: The following figure shows a forced expiration for a healthy person and a patient complaining of shortness of breath. The patient most likely has which of the following conditions?

A 5-year-old boy with weakness affecting the proximal muscles is found to have a mutation of a gene that encodes for the protein dystrophin. Genetic alteration in dystrophin lead to progressive muscle weakness because dystrophin provides structural support to the sarcolemma by binding with which of the following?

A research scientist attempts to understand the influence of carbon dioxide content in blood on its oxygen binding. The scientist adds carbon dioxide to dog blood and measures the uptake of oxygen in the blood versus oxygen pressure in the peripheral tissue. He notes in one dog that with the addition of carbon dioxide with a pressure of 90 mmHg, the oxygen pressure in the peripheral tissue rose from 26 to 33 mmHg. How can this phenomenon be explained?

options.label: A
options.text: Binding of O2 to hemoglobin in lungs drives release of CO2 from haemoglobin

options.label: B
options.text: The sum of the partial pressures of CO2 and O2 cannot exceed a known threshold in blood

options.label: C
options.text: High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues facilitates O2 unloading in peripheral tissues

options.label: D
options.text: High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues causes alkalemia, which is necessary for O2 unloading

questions.correct_answer: C. High partial pressure of CO2 in tissues facilitates O2 unloading in peripheral tissues

questions.text: A 61-year-old man had a cardiac arrest on the golf course. Almost 8 minutes of resuscitation, normal sinus rhythm with a blood pressure of 110/75 mm Hg is obtained. His neurologic examination done in the hospital one hour after the cardiac arrest reveals decorticate posturing and no eye opening in response to pain. The pupils are reactive. Oculocephalic and corneal reflexes are present but reduced bilaterally. All of the following are the physiological bases of decorticate posturing except?

options.label: A
options.text: Dominance of the excitatory reticulospinal pathway leading to rigidity of extensors in lower limbs

options.label: B
options.text: Rubrospinal excitation of flexors of upper limbs

options.label: C
options.text: Spasticity is due to facilitation of the gamma loop

options.label: D
options.text: Spasticity is due to inhibition of gamma loop

questions.correct_answer: D. Spasticity is due to inhibition of gamma loop

questions.text: After secretion of trypsinogen into the duodenum, the enzyme is converted into its active form, trypsin, by which of the following?

A medical student is studying the fluid exchange in skeletal muscle capillaries in a laboratory animal. He determines that fluid is being filtered out of the capillaries with a net filtration pressure of 10mmHg. He obtains the following values – Capillary hydrostatic pressure is 45mmHg Capillary oncotic pressure is 25 mmHg Interstitial oncotic pressure is 10mmHg Which of the following is the interstitial hydrostatic pressure?

A 15-year-old boy playing in his garden accidentally steps on a broken bottle with his bare right foot. His right leg immediately lifts up while his left leg extends even before he cries out in pain. Which of the following best describes the type of reflex and the centre involved in this reflex?

The body fluid volume changes in a 34 year old patient are shown below in Darrow-Yannet diagram (solid line – normal, dotted line – patient). Which of the following is the cause of this patient’s condition?

A 20-year-old man, victim of road traffic accident is brought to the Emergency and is diagnosed with hemi section of the left side of the spinal cord at C6. Which of the following function is likely to be lost in the right leg of this man?
Synaptic transmission between the pain fibres from the viscera in the pelvis to spinal cord neurons is mediated by which of the following?
